card.title: Ujjivan - Banking Sector, Corporate Learning & Development Teams
card.description: Gamified, branching eLearning modules for a banking L&D team, built with sprint-based production, visual logic maps, and parallel sub-teams to keep complex Yes/No paths coherent-delivered on time.

challenge.title: Challenge
challenge.text: High complexity in gamified design with branching logic for both 'Yes' and 'No' responses. Added difficulty in setting themes, writing realistic dialogues, and developing matching scenario-based activities.

goals.title: Goals
goals.text: Develop interactive, decision-driven learning modules. Reinforce workplace policies and soft skills through realistic, story-based simulations. Deliver a visually engaging and instructionally sound learning experience.

solution.title: Solution
solution.text: Designed scenario branches using visual logic maps to avoid narrative gaps.
details: Parallelized production with dedicated sub-teams for 'Yes' and 'No' paths.

implementation.title: Implementation - Sprint-Based Development
implementation.text: Cross-functional teams built scripts, characters, and animations in parallel.
details: Weekly stakeholder reviews for alignment and fast feedback.
Scenario trees visualized learner pathways and ensured logical flow.
Complex choice-based character responses pre-mapped with logic templates.
Packaging and rollout aligned to a Training management system model and existing Learning management systems (LMS).

results.title: Results
results.text: Complex branching scenarios delivered on time.
details: Strong learner engagement via interactive storytelling and realistic situations.
Modules praised for clarity, impact, and professional polish.

testimonial.quote: "We asked for multiple animated, scenario-driven modules in a very tight timeline, and the team delivered with precision and creativity. The branching structure, character animation, and real-life challenges made it truly immersive."
testimonial.author: Client Representative

keyTakeaway.title: Key Takeaway
keyTakeaway.text: Well-structured gamified eLearning requires careful logic planning, modular design, and cross-functional team synergy. With the right framework, even the most complex, choice-based training can be delivered efficiently and effectively.

cta.title: Access Banking Branching Simulation Story
cta.description: See how visual logic maps, parallel production, and scenario trees create realistic, decision-driven training for financial teams-plus best practices for crafting impactful E-learning content.
